data.title: Embassy of India, Zagreb, Croatia : Croatia
data.text: Parliamentary democracy. Parliament has one Chamber, the House of Representatives, with 151 members elected for a four-year term. The Government is led by Prime Minister Mr. Andrej Plenkovic (Croatian Democratic Union - HDZ). HDZ won parliamentary election held on July 5, 2020, and formed the Government on July 6, 2020, when HDZ leader Andrej Plenković announced that he had collected the support of the necessary 76 MPs needed to form a government, following coalition negotiations. He announced that he had received support from his party and allies, the Croatian People's Party – Liberal Democrats, the People's Party – Reformists, and all 8 representatives of the national minorities. The President is directly elected by the people for a five-year term and he is the head of state and the commander in chief of the Croatian Armed Forces. Mr. Zoran Milanovic took over as President on February 18, 2020.
